author: Special Correspondent
text:
K. Ganesh alias Ganesh Kumar, son of Karuppasamy of Angalakurichi near Anamalai in Pollachi, suspected to be a Maoist supporter and wanted in connection with two cases died of kidney-related ailment at Coimbatore Medical College Hospital in the small hours of Thursday.

The accused, hailing from Pudu Colony in Angalakurichi, was wanted by the police in connection with a case of a missing youth. Following a police complaint from parents of Santhoshkumar, that their son was brainwashed and taken away from them for recruiting him in a Maoist outfit, the Anamalai police registered a case against Ganesh Kumar under various provisions of Indian Penal Code in August 2014. Ganesh Kumar was also facing a case for allegedly instigating and making a group of family trespass into the Anamalai Tiger Reserve and start living inside the forest as a mark of protest against the State.
title: Suspected Maoist supporter dies
